text: Paul Arthur MÃ¼ller-Lehning (23 October 1899 - 1 January 2000) was a Dutch writer, historian and anarchist. He was born in Utrecht. He was known for French translations of Mikhail Bakunin works. In 1992, he won the Gouden Ganzenveer, and in 1999, the P. C. Hooft Award. Lehning died on 1 January 2000 in Lys-Saint-Georges, Indre, France. He was 100. ==References== Category:1899 births Category:2000 deaths Category:Anarchists Category:Dutch centenarians Category:Dutch historians Category:Dutch translators Category:Writers from Utrecht (city)
title: Arthur Lehning
